title: Moving the plates of a charged capacitor

content.question: In the above circuit, the capacitor is connected to an ideal battery of voltage <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and allowed to fully charge. The plates are then moved farther apart, as shown in the figure. Which of the following claims best decribes the outcome of moving the plates?

choices.label: The potential difference across the plates of the capacitor increases.
The potential difference across the plates of the capacitor decreases.
The charge stored on the capacitor increases.
The charge stored on the capacitor decreases.
The energy stored on the capacitor stays the same.

content.answer: The charge stored on the capacitor decreases.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
